item.name: Agricola
item.wishlistcomment: I honestly have enough worker placement games, and I have this on the iPad. I suck something special at Agricola for some reason and yet.. and yet I kinda want it. Rawr.

item.name: Android: Netrunner – A Study in Static
Cards Against Humanity: 12 Days of Holiday Bullshit
Cards Against Humanity: The Bigger, Blacker Box
Carnival
item.comment: Great little game I picked up half off at an Indie Gamer Sale. It plays great with two players, well with three, and excited to try four. It has some interesting new game mechanics that make it a nice addition to game night.

item.name: Catan: Cities & Knights
item.comment: This expansion makes the game. I don't like to play normal Catan anymore (damn you dice!) but throw on Cities and Knights? I'm so there.

item.name: Chrononauts
item.comment:
I bought this game mainly because I wanted something I could play alone, with another person, or with a group. Something not very PvP - but not completely separated player interactions.
This game delivers. I played it once alone to learn the mechanics and was immediately hooked. I pitched it to my friends after a long and drawn out game of Small World - and then we continued to play until 2 in the morning. My friends are really picky when it comes to games... I've never been the person to stop playing a game that I owned, but tonight was apparently the night for firsts. Damn you work in the morning!

item.name: CO₂
item.wishlistcomment: I'll be honest, the cover is what got me here.

item.name: Dominant Species
item.wishlistcomment: I have now had a chance to play this and while I liked it, I'm not sure it's a must have. I'm bumping it down a little, because I still liked it and would like it, though.

item.name: Dragon's Hoard
item.comment: It's an okay trick taking card game? If that's what it is. The art is AMAZING, but the game play left my group and I a little bored. This would be a fun one with kids, though. Just maybe not a group of hard-core gamers coming off of a big Euro.

item.name: Dungeon Command: Curse of Undeath
item.wishlistcomment: I play DnD & DM for a session and while I'm not sure the actual game would get a lot of play, the minis definitely would.

item.name: Dungeon Command: Heart of Cormyr
item.wishlistcomment: I play DnD & DM for a session and while I'm not sure the actual game would get a lot of play, the minis definitely would.

item.name: Dungeon Command: Sting of Lolth
item.wishlistcomment: I play DnD & DM for a session and while I'm not sure the actual game would get a lot of play, the minis definitely would.

item.name: Eclipse
item.wishlistcomment: I'll be honest, the likelihood of getting this on my table is slim. But! I enjoy the iPad version immensely and wish taht I could play the real version with my friends.

item.name: Eight-Minute Empire
item.wishlistcomment: People will not shut up about this game, so of course I am thinking of getting it.

item.name: Elder Sign
item.wishlistcomment: This is the only game from this line that I can stand, and would actually kind of like to own.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Formula D
item.wishlistcomment: I might just want this for the chance to make "vroom" noises while pretending to drift through the corners.

item.name: Hanabi
item.wishlistcomment: I had this in my hand at a store and the employee talked me out of it! I should have gone with my gut!!

item.name: Le Havre: The Inland Port
item.wishlistcomment: I have teh 2-player Agricola and LOVE it. My neighbor and bestie has this one and we've played it a few times, but again he's out of town so often I'd kinda like my own copy.

item.name: Jaipur
item.wishlistcomment: I was recently told that this is a two player must have, so I have added it to my list.

item.name: K2
item.wishlistcomment: I love snow and winter and I think that this would be a fantastic game to play this ski season with my friends while we're snowed in. That and think of the reviews!

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
Ladies & Gentlemen
item.wishlistcomment: I kinda want this just to make my male friends talk about shoes, but really I want it because I get to listen to my male friends talk about shoes. I'm not sure it'd get a lot of play with the high player count, but it'd get a few solid games in, at least.

item.name: Legacy: Gears of Time – GenCon Indy Promo Card
Legacy: Gears of Time – Kickstarter Backer Promo Card
The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.wishlistcomment: I just got LoW and I can not stop playing! I've been told that the Expansion is a must, so I must!

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.wishlistcomment: Another Two Player game that I wish I had gotten when I saw it on sale.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Power Grid: Australia & Indian Subcontinent
item.wishlistcomment: I love Powergrid, and so does my family. We just need more maps. All the maps! All of them!

item.name: Power Grid: China/Korea
item.wishlistcomment: I love Powergrid, and so does my family. We just need more maps. All the maps! All of them!

item.name: Power Grid: Factory Manager
item.wishlistcomment: I love Powergrid, and so does my family. We just need more maps. All the maps! All of them! (And managers)

item.name: Power Grid: Northern Europe/United Kingdom & Ireland
item.wishlistcomment: I love Powergrid, and so does my family. We just need more maps. All the maps! All of them!

item.name: Power Grid: The Robots
item.wishlistcomment: I love Powergrid, and so does my family. We just need more maps. All the maps! All of them! (And Robots)

item.name: Risk Legacy
item.wishlistcomment: You can write on the board. You can change the landscape of the board. How would you not want this?

item.name: RoboRally
item.wishlistcomment: I played Super RoboRally at GenCon and got hooked. I now wish to try and win this game for real.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Vengeance
item.wishlistcomment: I was late to the Sentinels game and now I am sorely missing expansions.

item.name: Settlers of America: Trails to Rails
Snowdonia
item.wishlistcomment: It has snow in the title... AND IS ABOUT TRAINS (kinda).

item.name: SOS Titanic
item.comment:
I wanted to like this game, but in the end it just felt like a themed, multiplayer game of solitare. I wasn't ever worried of sinking the ship, though that may have more to do with good luck on the shuffling.
It was okay solo, but I have other solo games I rather play.

item.name: Space Dice
item.comment: The table-wiping dice kinda kills this game, as does the size of the dice. It's a very pretty game, I'll give you that, but the dice are too large to really rattle around in the container. The bit with the direction of the die is very interesting, and adds a twist, but I've yet to have a play last less than half an hour because of the damn Supernova.

item.name: String Railway
item.wishlistcomment: I LOVE TRAINSSSSSSS!

item.name: Suburbia
item.wishlistcomment: I played this at a work game night and I can not get it out of my head. I want to play it again, but the gentleman that brought it can't make game nights frequently.

item.name: Tammany Hall
item.wishlistcomment: This is another game that I regret not getting in on the Kickstarter for. I know it'll probably not get played that often, but a girl can dream.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.wishlistcomment: I saw some guys playing this at my LGS and it just drew me in. I haven't had a chance to play it yet myself, but it looks amazing.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 – Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 3 – The Heart of Africa
Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
Tsuro
item.comment: A quick, good for groups, pathway tile placement game. I liked it 10 plays ago, but now I only use it to get people into gaming (it's not something I prefer to pull out and play).

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.wishlistcomment: I'm not a big war gamer/direct combat person but this is #1 on the BGG list. Just screams for a review.

item.name: We Didn't Playtest This At All
